posts.name: Big Gay Ice Cream Shop
posts.note: With a playful attitude, Big Gay Ice Cream spins a new take on old-school soft-serve by creating fun and unique ice creams, toppings, and frozen treats that appeal to a diverse mix of clientele.

posts.name: Cafe Orlin
posts.note: Longtime cafe serving American and Middle Eastern food, best enjoyed on the streetside patio and have a great weekend brunch.

posts.name: Carnegie Deli
posts.note: At this old-school deli, diners fill up on pastrami, corned beef, matzoh balls & other staples.

posts.name: Crif Dogs
posts.note: Hot dogs with creative toppings and late-night hours make this spot a natural for post-bar munchies.

posts.name: Doughnut Plant
posts.note: Making doughnuts by hand with the highest quality all natural ingredients since 1994.

posts.name: Eataly
posts.note: They love high-quality food and drink. They love the stories about it, the people who produce it, and the places it comes from.

posts.name: The Halal Guys
posts.note: Once you have had a taste, you will understand why New Yorkers and tourists alike have stood in the city’s longest food cart line (sometimes for hours) to get a hot, steaming platter of chicken or gyro over rice, covered in The Halal Guys famous, proprietary White Sauce. Can't go wrong with the chicken and lamb over rice.

posts.name: Ivan Ramen Slurp Shop
posts.note: Besides ramen, this noodle counter in Gotham West Market serves rice bowls and sides.

posts.name: Salt and Pepper
posts.note: Casual eatery displaying ample hot American, Spanish, Indian and Pakistani dishes. I have found the Indian and Pakistani food to be the best such as the curry lamb or goat with chickpeas over rice.

posts.name: The Meatball Shop
posts.note: Fast casual service restaurant specializing in meatballs with 6 locations in New York City.

posts.name: New Wonjo (24 hrs)
posts.note: Always-open Korean BBQ mainstay distinguishing itself with charcoal-fueled grills.
